page.title: 15BANCHORY DEVENICK CHURCH II
page.content: The site of the church has been a place of worship since the{800's}when {St.Devenick}founded a settlement here. He brought Christianity here and did most of his work here. He is buried beneath the south wall of the existing building. During the{1600's}this was a{Roman {Catholic settlement}run by priests but then came the{Reformation}and the first minister of the Presbyterian Church. { George Morrison}was our most famous minister for he built{The Shakin' Brig over the Dee joining the two old parts of the parish. Since then the River has changed course and the bridge is no longer in use and is now in disrepair.
